intro: Conoclinium resinosum, commonly known as the resinous honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces a sticky resin, which gives it its common name and contributes to its distinctive scent. Its flowers are typically violet to purple in color and attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Conoclinium resinosum is often found in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade.
